quick_answer.text: One tablespoon of butter contains about 102 kcal, mostly from fat.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tbsp unsalted butter?
faqs.a: About 102 kcal, same as salted; sodium is lower (~2 mg).

faqs.q: Is butter high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tbsp has ~7.3 g saturated fat, which is ~37% of daily recommended limit.

faqs.q: How much fat is in 1 tbsp of butter?
faqs.a: Approximately 11.5 g total fat, with no carbs or protein.
Yes, ~31 mg per tbsp, all from animal fat.

faqs.q: What's the difference in calories for margarine vs butter?
faqs.a: Margarine is often similar (~100 kcal) but varies; check labels for trans fats.
